column4: is this the place to ask questions about problems with ubuntu?
yes
ok after my battery went empty while going into suspend i cannot restart my system
it just dumps me on an ash shell, and doesnt find init.
grub sees the files on my drive but it can't be mounted by the live cd
dmesg gives me a lot of ata errors
can anyone help me there?
did you try "startx" at the shell?
I should ask, which version are you using?
no√º
ubuntu, kubuntu, etc., server/desktop/netbook etc.
*nope its a busybox terminal, the kernel panics. ubuntu desktop

So to recap: your computer was in suspend mode and hte battery died, and now you cannot boot it at all. You were using the standard, plain vanilla Ubuntu Desktop (GNOME). Trying to run startx causes the kernel to panic. Does that sum it up?
<econdudeawesome> nope.
<econdudeawesome> my computer was going into hibernate and battery died. upon booting, the kernel cannot mount my root file system and does therefore not find /sbin/init.
<econdudeawesome> and therefore kernel panics.
got it. This is out of my expertise. Does anyone else know how to help blubb?
there seems to be something wrong with my hd or file system.
<econdudeawesome> i would guess hd, since dd gives me errors when i try to copy data to an image
I'm not sure. Are you able to access the files at all? It sounds like you have a major hard drive crash if that is the case
